tool.name: PeakPickerHiRes
tool.description: Finds mass spectrometric peaks in profile mass spectra.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: input profile data file

param.name: signal_to_noise
param.label: Minimal signal-to-noise ratio for a peak to be picked (0.0 disables SNT estimation!)

param.name: spacing_difference_gap
param.label: The extension of a peak is stopped if the spacing between two subsequent data points exceeds 'spacing_difference_gap * min_spacing'
param.help: 'min_spacing' is the smaller of the two spacings from the peak apex to its two neighboring points. '0' to disable the constraint. Not applicable to chromatograms

param.name: spacing_difference
param.label: Maximum allowed difference between points during peak extension, in multiples of the minimal difference between the peak apex and its two neighboring points
param.help: If this difference is exceeded a missing point is assumed (see parameter 'missing'). A higher value implies a less stringent peak definition, since individual signals within the peak are allowed to be further apart. '0' to disable the constraint. Not applicable to chromatograms

param.name: missing
param.label: Maximum number of missing points allowed when extending a peak to the left or to the right
param.help: A missing data point occurs if the spacing between two subsequent data points exceeds 'spacing_difference * min_spacing'. 'min_spacing' is the smaller of the two spacings from the peak apex to its two neighboring points. Not applicable to chromatograms

param.name: ms_levels
param.label: List of MS levels for which the peak picking is applied
param.help: If empty, auto mode is enabled, all peaks which aren't picked yet will get picked. Other scans are copied to the output without changes (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

validator.message: a space separated list of integer values in the range 1: is required

expand.validator: len(value.split(' ')) == len([_ for _ in value.split(' ') if 1 <= int(_)])

param.name: report_FWHM
param.label: Add metadata for FWHM (as floatDataArray named 'FWHM' or 'FWHM_ppm', depending on param 'report_FWHM_unit') for each picked peak

param.name: report_FWHM_unit
param.label: Unit of FWHM
param.help: Either absolute in the unit of input, e.g. 'm/z' for spectra, or relative as ppm (only sensible for spectra, not chromatograms)

param.name: max_intensity
param.label: maximal intensity considered for histogram construction
param.help: By default, it will be calculated automatically (see auto_mode). Only provide this parameter if you know what you are doing (and change 'auto_mode' to '-1')! All intensities EQUAL/ABOVE 'max_intensity' will be added to the LAST histogram bin. If you choose 'max_intensity' too small, the noise estimate might be too small as well. If chosen too big, the bins become quite large (which you could counter by increasing 'bin_count', which increases runtime). In general, the Median-S/N estimator is more robust to a manual max_intensity than the MeanIterative-S/N

param.name: auto_max_stdev_factor
param.label: parameter for 'max_intensity' estimation (if 'auto_mode' == 0): mean + 'auto_max_stdev_factor' * stdev

param.name: auto_max_percentile
param.label: parameter for 'max_intensity' estimation (if 'auto_mode' == 1): auto_max_percentile th percentile

param.name: auto_mode
param.label: method to use to determine maximal intensity: -1 --> use 'max_intensity'; 0 --> 'auto_max_stdev_factor' method (default); 1 --> 'auto_max_percentile' method

param.name: win_len
param.label: window length in Thomson

param.name: bin_count
param.label: number of bins for intensity values

param.name: min_required_elements
param.label: minimum number of elements required in a window (otherwise it is considered sparse)

param.name: noise_for_empty_window
param.label: noise value used for sparse windows

param.name: write_log_messages
param.label: Write out log messages in case of sparse windows or median in rightmost histogram bin

param.name: processOption
param.label: Whether to load all data and process them in-memory or whether to process the data on the fly (lowmemory) without loading the whole file into memory first

param.name: force
param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Finds mass spectrometric peaks in profile mass spectra.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_PeakPickerHiRes.html
